title: [Large-Scale] Modular Mastery-Based Computer Science Fundamentals for Adult Learners: Strengthening Digital Citizenship and Social Problem-Solving Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and logical thinking skills, foundational understanding of digital environments, interest in solving social issues, and basic awareness of civic rights and community engagement
context.additional_context: Modular progression aligned with self-directed learning pace in digital device-provided environments. Includes data-driven case studies for community problem-solving, fostering social learning environments through peer knowledge sharing and spreading civic engagement culture. Develops comprehensive problem-solving competencies via interdisciplinary approaches (economics, politics, geography).

learning_goals: Learners select and complete one of three real-life projects (automated household budget calculation, schedule management system, community data analysis) using basic programming syntax (conditionals, loops, functions), submit results within a week that receive an average of 4/5 or higher in peer evaluations and 8/10 or higher in instructor feedback, thereby cultivating problem-solving skills applying concepts of civic rights and digital citizenship

Mastering core concepts at their own pace through module-based mastery assessments (80% or higher), cultivating the ability to solve social problems using digital tools, and strengthening data-driven decision-making capabilities for community development

Experiencing team-based software development processes using collaboration tools, enhancing collaborative competencies as digital citizens, and establishing inclusive problem-solving strategies based on intercultural understanding
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
